selected_quotes: Guía Práctica Clínica EASL: Colangitis Biliar Primaria (antiguamente conocida como Cirrosis Biliar Primaria) @AEEHLiver
Actualizacion de la guia de practica clinica europea de la #colangitis biliar primaria
Updates to the Diagnosis and Management of Primary Biliary Cholangitis .CPG
Clinical Guidelines The diagnosis and management of patients with primary biliary cholangitis #JHEP #PBC #Guidelines
Clinical Guidelines The diagnosis and management of patients with primary biliary cholangitis #JHEP…

citation.abstract: Primary biliary cholangitis (PBC) is a chronic inflammatory autoimmune cholestatic liver disease, which when untreated will culminate in end-stage biliary cirrhosis. Diagnosis is usually based on the presence of serum liver tests indicative of a cholestatic hepatitis in association with circulating antimitochondrial antibodies. Patient presentation and course can be diverse and risk stratification is important to ensure all patients receive a personalised approach to their care. The goals of treatment and management are the prevention of end-stage liver disease, and the amelioration of associated symptoms. Pharmacologic approaches in practice, to reduce the impact of the progressive nature of disease, currently include licensed therapies (ursodeoxycholic acid and obeticholic acid) and off-label therapies (fibric acid derivatives, budesonide). These clinical practice guidelines summarise the evidence for the importance of a structured, life-long and individualised, approach to the care of patients with PBC, providing a framework to help clinicians diagnose and effectively manage patients.
citation.title: EASL Clinical Practice Guidelines: The diagnosis and management of patients with primary biliary cholangitis
